This position is for an Analyst with experience in Project Controls and/or Scheduling. The Project Controls Analyst (“PCA”) will work with diverse clients ranging from small and medium size organizations to large Fortune 100 enterprises to design and implement Project Controls and/or Scheduling solutions. Working in a team environment, the individual in this role will develop, analyze and optimize clients’ processes related to project controls, and assess the organization’s effectiveness pertaining to the scheduling function. The primary responsibilities of this role include development of the project controls system and processes and performing project controls duties on assigned projects. Project controls duties include preparation of cost and resource loaded schedules, earned value reports, and other progress monitoring tools.

Job Responsibilities:

In general, the Project Controls Analyst will perform the following job responsibilities in addition to others as required for each project:

The Analyst serves as an important resource to project teams in support of the project controls and/or scheduling function. The PCA will work with the project team and interface with the client to benchmark existing project controls and scheduling methodologies, design and present improvements, and oversee recommendations’ implementations.
Possess the ability to establish and monitor all project controls activities, potentially on multiple projects.
Compare current status versus established baselines and forecasts and contribute to the analysis and explanation of variances.
Identify future potential cost and schedule impact and provide guidance to project teams.
Analyze installed quantities and expenditures of hours to derive earned value.
Coordinate the preparation and analysis of project reports and scorecards, assuming responsibility for overall accuracy, completeness and timeliness.
Maintain work breakdown structures for accurate reporting.
Review and analysis of external and internal contractor progress and performance.
Adapt the project controls plan, as required, for a specific project scope of work.

General PCA Qualifications:

Qualified candidates for Project Controls Analyst Level positions will have the following qualifications:

Undergraduate Degree in technical field with two years of professional experience, or an associate degree with an equivalent combination of education and experience
Strong skills in presentation, word processing, and spreadsheet applications.
Demonstrated success in analysis driven problem solving.
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills.
Ability to work effectively in a high-pressure, time-sensitive environment.
Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and influence without authority or title.
Ability to maintain confidential and sensitive materials and information.
Ability to work in team environment, hand-in-hand with client, and deliver solid results in a demanding work environment.
Ability to establish effective working relationships with client personnel.

Project Controls Analyst Qualifications:

In addition to the general qualifications, it is highly desirable that the PCA have one or more of the following Subject Matter Area Qualifications:

Working knowledge of Project Control functions and processes – including planning/scheduling, cost control, cost estimating, Earned Value Management, change management, financial and project accounting standards and systems.
Planning and scheduling skills specifically related to construction management.
Thorough knowledge of Project Scheduling Applications (e.g. Primavera, MS Project) including implementation, configuration, and administration.

In addition to the general qualifications required it is desirable, although not essential, that the PCA have one or more of the following Subject Matter Area Qualifications:

Degree in technical field related to Project Management (e.g. Construction Management) is a plus.
Formal project management related credential (e.g. PMP) is a plus.
End-to-end project management, portfolio management or enterprise project/application portfolio management solutions knowledge and experience is also a plus.

Position Summary:
The Senior Project Analyst – Value Management is responsible for supporting the implementation of initiatives focused on delivering strategic value. Under the guidance of the Vice President or a Project Manager, the role leverages analytical skills to support metrics development and performance measurement on data-driven initiatives. The analyst will also translate strategic information and complex data analyses into compelling, executive-level plans and presentations.

The Senior Project Analyst will develop skills in project management, process improvement, and organizational change with the goal of ultimately managing large initiatives that impact operations and influence strategic goal achievement. The role involves designing and executing quantitative analyses, conducting research, developing and delivering executive-level presentations, and supporting process optimization exercises based on Continuous Improvement principles (Six Sigma, Lean).

Key Responsibilities:
Translate quantitative and qualitative concepts into complex business models and key performance indicators.
Accurately apply administrative, clinical, financial, market, and demographic data for data-driven improvement initiatives.
Design and execute quantitative analyses to support hypotheses and drive performance improvement insights.
Conduct independent analysis, collect data, identify data integrity risks, and develop action plans to cleanse data.
Conduct external/internal research on new concepts and subject matter.
Develop and deliver compelling executive-level presentations.
Support process optimization exercises using Continuous Improvement principles.
Present analyses and insights to project leadership, translating findings into impactful initiatives.
Review key performance indicators and create variance reports to monitor progress.
Recommend improvements based on findings to provide additional benefits and value.
Build skills in the OVM project management methodology and lead smaller projects of medium complexity.
Build and maintain an internal network for information support.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Required Education:
Bachelor’s degree and at least 3 years of relevant work experience OR
High School Diploma/GED and at least 5 years of relevant work experience.

Required Certifications & Licensure:
Preferred: Project Management Institute certification (e.g., CAPM, PMI-PBA), Certification in Lean or Six Sigma methodologies.

Required:
3 years of healthcare data analytics; 3 years of PowerBI experience; Advanced MS Office experience (Excel knowledge including pivot tables, power pivot/data modeling, formulas, charting, etc.).
Understanding of a broad range of data types (administrative, financial, demographic, market, clinical) and business performance metrics, benchmarks, targets, and calculations.
Financial analysis and financial modeling experience.
Experience in data gathering and business analysis, including structuring and translating data into meaningful information for the audience.
Experience partnering with colleagues from various parts of an organization to collect, synthesize, organize, and interpret complex data sets.

Preferred:
Degree/training in industrial engineering, finance, or business.
Experience in performance/process improvement projects, especially those involving Lean or Six Sigma methodologies.
Experience managing healthcare-related projects and familiarity with the healthcare provider industry.
Familiarity with healthcare-specific data and systems.
Epic data analysis experience with Slicer Dicer and/or Cogito is a plus but not required.

Remote work available but must be within a 1-hour drive of Irvine, CA (not negotiable).
Required to be onsite for initial training and one meeting a month.

We are looking for a Project Control Analyst with a keen interest in project controls, system management, and compliance, and experience interfacing with Programs and Capture to join our team. You will join our rapidly growing team at Persistent Systems’ New York City headquarters and help to support the successful operation of the company’s contracting and capture functions. This position offers visibility and requires extensive contact with all program team members, contracts team, and accounting staff in the development of Cost and Compliance tracking efforts. This includes understanding contractual management through compliance and cost tracking for ongoing programs. Activities include planning, tracking, and management of cost to actuals in accordance with customer requirements and current government regulations, laws, and company policies.

Position Responsibilities
Establish and maintain project controls, including document and system management, change management, and performance measurement
Ensure compliance with project management standards and best practices
Collaborate with legal and contract teams to ensure that projects adhere to relevant regulations and contractual requirements

Monitor changes in project scope and assess their impact on project financials

Strong analytical skills and proficiency in financial analysis and reporting
Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely
